author: ryanleeschneider
content:
I see in https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/27099 that the Eth DevOps team recently stood up new Sepolia bootnodes that were included in geth 1.11.6.  I'm trying to use those same bootnodes in erigon (which seems to otherwise have trouble peering on Sepolia)  but even after waiting a bit I'm not seeing my erigon node pickup any devp2p peers (I'm using an external CL so am getting blocks just fine).  Does erigon require erigon-specific bootnodes?  I see the original sepolia bootnodes for erigon were added in this PR (https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/3462/files#diff-c13a1b5c84048a832e07e3503cc35f66614816cb39fe1e2fdd992672a9e1d883) but I can't find those enodes in geth's history so not sure where they came from.

Anyways, if anyone has suggestions on a) some working Sepolia bootnodes for erigon and b) a possible PR to erigon to help make things easier I'd be happy to help on said PR.
